required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Subcutaneous Immune Globulin in Patients Requiring IgG Replacement Therapy (EU Extension Study)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Extension Study of the Efficacy, Tolerability, and Safety of Immune Globulin Subcutaneous (Human) IgPro20 in Subjects With Primary Immunodeficiency (IgPro20 EU Extension Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a continuation of the study ZLB06_001CR with the objective of assessing efficacy, tolerability, safety of IgPro, as well as long-term health-related quality of life in patients with PID.

primary_outcome.description: The IgG trough values per subject were aggregated to a median value, and then median values across subjects were summarized using descriptive statistics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Rate of Clinically Documented Serious Bacterial Infections (SBIs)
secondary_outcome.description: The annualized rate was based on the total number of SBIs and the total number of subject study days for all subjects in the specified analysis population and adjusted to 365 days. Potential SBIs included bacterial pneumonia, bacteremia and septicemia, osteomyelitis/septic arthritis, bacterial meningitis, and visceral abscess. If an adverse event (AE) was identified as a potential SBI, the AE was adjudicated by the Medical Monitor and Investigator to determine if the event fulfilled the predefined criteria for SBIs.

The annualized rate was based on the total number of infection episodes occurring during the study divided by the total number of subject study days for all subjects in the specified analysis population and adjusted to 365 days.
Total number of infections for the specified analysis population

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Rate of Days Out of Work / School / Kindergarten / Day Care or Unable to Perform Normal Activities Due to Infections
secondary_outcome.description: The annualized rate was based on the total number of days out of work / school / kindergarten / day care or inability to perform normal activities due to infection, and the total number of subject diary days for all subjects in the specified analysis population and adjusted to 365 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days Out of Work / School / Kindergarten / Day Care or Unable to Perform Normal Activities Due to Infections
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of days out of work / school / kindergarten / day care or unable to perform normal activities due to infections, for the specified analysis population

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Rate of Hospitalization Due to Infections
secondary_outcome.description: The annualized rate was based on the total number of days of hospitalization due to infections and the total number of subject diary days for all subjects in the specified analysis population and adjusted to 365 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Hospitalization Due to Infections
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of days of hospitalization due to infections for the specified analysis population

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of Antibiotics for Infection Prophylaxis and Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized rate of days with antibiotics for infection prophylaxis and treatment. The annualized rate was based on the total number of days of antibiotic use for infection prophylaxis and treatment in the efficacy period, and the total number of subject study days for all subjects in the specified analysis population, and adjusted to 365 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life (Short Form 36 Health Survey)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at the last available post-baseline observation for each subject (up to 42 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The Short Form 36 Health Survey (SF-36) is a 36-item questionnaire that measures generic health concepts that are relevant across age, disease, and treatment groups. The questions are grouped into eight domains: physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating a better health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Relevant Changes in Vital Signs From Baseline to the Completion Visit.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (data either from Infusion 40 or the completion visit of study ZLB06_001CR), and at completion (up to 42 months).
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of subjects with clinically relevant changes in vital signs from baseline to the completion visit. Vital signs included heart rate, systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, and body temperature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Significant Abnormal Changes in Routine Laboratory Parameters Between Baseline and the Completion Visit.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (data either from Infusion 40 or the completion visit of study ZLB06_001CR), and at completion (up to 42 months).
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of subjects with clinically significant abnormal changes in routine laboratory parameters between baseline and the completion visit. Routine laboratory parameters included haematology, serum chemistry and urinalysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate, Severity and Relatedness of Any Adverse Events (AEs) Per Infusion
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of AEs was the number of AEs over the number of infusions administered. Mild AE: Did not interfere with routine activities; Moderate AE: Interfered somewhat with routine activities; Severe AE: Impossible to perform routine activities. At least possibly related AEs included possibly related AEs, probably related AEs, and related AEs.

arm_group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with primary humoral immunodeficiency, namely with a diagnosis of Common variable immunodeficiency (CVID) as defined by the Pan-American Group for Immunodeficiency (PAGID) and the European Society for Immunodeficiencies (ESID), or X-linked agammaglobulinemia (XLA) as defined by PAGID and ESID, or autosomal recessive agammaglobulinemia who have participated in the study ZLB06_001CR and who have tolerated IgPro well
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypoalbuminemia, protein-losing enteropathies, and any proteinuria (defined as total urine protein concentration > 0.2g/L)
- Other significant medical conditions that could increase the risk to the subject
- Females who are pregnant, breast feeding or planning a pregnancy during the course of the study
- Participation in a study with an investigational medicinal product within three months prior to enrollment, except for ZLB06_001CR
- Evidence of uncooperative attitude
- Any condition that is likely to interfere with evaluation of the IMP or satisfactory conduct of the study
- Subjects who are employees at the investigational site, relatives or spouse of the investigator

link.description: Click here to request more information about this study

results_reference.citation: Jolles S, Borte M, Nelson RP Jr, Rojavin M, Bexon M, Lawo JP, Wasserman RL. Long-term efficacy, safety, and tolerability of Hizentra® for treatment of primary immunodeficiency disease. Clin Immunol. 2014 Feb;150(2):161-9. doi: 10.1016/j.clim.2013.10.008. Epub 2013 Oct 26.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects who had previously participated in the pivotal study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997) were enrolled in the extension study ZLB07_002CR.

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

outcome.title: Total Serum IgG Trough Levels
outcome.description: The IgG trough values per subject were aggregated to a median value, and then median values across subjects were summarized using descriptive statistics.
outcome.population: The “all treated” (AT) safety data set comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the “Full Analysis/intention-to-treat” (ITT) data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available.

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

measure.title: Total Serum IgG Trough Levels
measure.description: The IgG trough values per subject were aggregated to a median value, and then median values across subjects were summarized using descriptive statistics.
measure.population: The “all treated” (AT) safety data set comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the “Full Analysis/intention-to-treat” (ITT) data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available.

outcome.title: Annualized Rate of Clinically Documented Serious Bacterial Infections (SBIs)
outcome.description: The annualized rate was based on the total number of SBIs and the total number of subject study days for all subjects in the specified analysis population and adjusted to 365 days. Potential SBIs included bacterial pneumonia, bacteremia and septicemia, osteomyelitis/septic arthritis, bacterial meningitis, and visceral abscess. If an adverse event (AE) was identified as a potential SBI, the AE was adjudicated by the Medical Monitor and Investigator to determine if the event fulfilled the predefined criteria for SBIs.
outcome.population: The AT safety data set comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the ITT data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available.

outcome.title: Health Related Quality of Life (Short Form 36 Health Survey)
outcome.description: The Short Form 36 Health Survey (SF-36) is a 36-item questionnaire that measures generic health concepts that are relevant across age, disease, and treatment groups. The questions are grouped into eight domains: physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating a better health state.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at the last available post-baseline observation for each subject (up to 42 months)
outcome.population: The analysis population comprised the Full-Analysis health related quality of life (HRQL) data set (defined as all subjects entered into the study who complete a baseline and at least 1 follow-up HRQL assessment), who were at least 15 years of age.

group.title: IgPro20 - At End of Study
group.description: SF-36 score at end of study (defined as the last available post-baseline observation for each subject).

measure.title: Health Related Quality of Life (Short Form 36 Health Survey)
measure.description: The Short Form 36 Health Survey (SF-36) is a 36-item questionnaire that measures generic health concepts that are relevant across age, disease, and treatment groups. The questions are grouped into eight domains: physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating a better health state.
measure.population: The analysis population comprised the Full-Analysis health related quality of life (HRQL) data set (defined as all subjects entered into the study who complete a baseline and at least 1 follow-up HRQL assessment), who were at least 15 years of age.

outcome.title: Clinically Relevant Changes in Vital Signs From Baseline to the Completion Visit.
outcome.description: The total number of subjects with clinically relevant changes in vital signs from baseline to the completion visit. Vital signs included heart rate, systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, and body temperature.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (data either from Infusion 40 or the completion visit of study ZLB06_001CR), and at completion (up to 42 months).
outcome.population: The AT safety data set (which comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the ITT data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available) and for whom vital signs data was collected at both baseline and completion.

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

measure.title: Clinically Relevant Changes in Vital Signs From Baseline to the Completion Visit.
measure.description: The total number of subjects with clinically relevant changes in vital signs from baseline to the completion visit. Vital signs included heart rate, systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, and body temperature.
measure.population: The AT safety data set (which comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the ITT data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available) and for whom vital signs data was collected at both baseline and completion.

outcome.title: Clinically Significant Abnormal Changes in Routine Laboratory Parameters Between Baseline and the Completion Visit.
outcome.description: The total number of subjects with clinically significant abnormal changes in routine laboratory parameters between baseline and the completion visit. Routine laboratory parameters included haematology, serum chemistry and urinalysis.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (data either from Infusion 40 or the completion visit of study ZLB06_001CR), and at completion (up to 42 months).
outcome.population: The AT safety data set (which comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the ITT data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available) and for whom laboratory parameter data was collected at both baseline and completion.

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

measure.title: Clinically Significant Abnormal Changes in Routine Laboratory Parameters Between Baseline and the Completion Visit.
measure.description: The total number of subjects with clinically significant abnormal changes in routine laboratory parameters between baseline and the completion visit. Routine laboratory parameters included haematology, serum chemistry and urinalysis.
measure.population: The AT safety data set (which comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period and was identical to the ITT data set that comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 and for whom any efficacy data was available) and for whom laboratory parameter data was collected at both baseline and completion.

outcome.title: Rate, Severity and Relatedness of Any Adverse Events (AEs) Per Infusion
outcome.description: The rate of AEs was the number of AEs over the number of infusions administered. Mild AE: Did not interfere with routine activities; Moderate AE: Interfered somewhat with routine activities; Severe AE: Impossible to perform routine activities. At least possibly related AEs included possibly related AEs, probably related AEs, and related AEs.
outcome.population: The AT safety data set comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period.

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

measure.title: Rate, Severity and Relatedness of Any Adverse Events (AEs) Per Infusion
measure.description: The rate of AEs was the number of AEs over the number of infusions administered. Mild AE: Did not interfere with routine activities; Moderate AE: Interfered somewhat with routine activities; Severe AE: Impossible to perform routine activities. At least possibly related AEs included possibly related AEs, probably related AEs, and related AEs.
measure.population: The AT safety data set comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period.

class.title: At least possibly related and serious AEs

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were collected for the duration of the study, up to 42 months.
reported_events.desc: A total of 5405 weekly infusions of IgPro20 were administered to 40 subjects in this study. Three subjects received fewer than 100 infusions. The AT safety data set comprised all subjects treated with IgPro20 during any study period. AEs in “General disorders” were collected under the MedDRA SOC General disorders and administration site conditions.

group.title: IgPro20
group.description: Subcutaneous administration by the subject/parent/guardian with the planned weekly dose of IgPro20 to be the same as the subject's last dose recommended by the investigator in study ZLB06_001CR (NCT00542997).

event.description: This AE was collected under the MedDRA System Organ Class (SOC) General disorders and administration site conditions.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: CSL agreements and restrictions on publishing may vary with individual investigators; however, CSL will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. CSL supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial and generally requires that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
